answers.answer: The largest railway operators serving main cities in Romania are CFR Călători, Transferoviar Călători, Regio Călători, Interregional Călători, and Astra Trans Carpatic.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Transport Train info'.

answers.answer: You can buy international train tickets through cfrcalatori.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Transport Train info'.

answers.answer: It is recommended to use apps like Free Now, Uber, or Bolt to take a ride, as these services cover all major cities in Romania and are available in English.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Taxi'.

answers.answer: To request help from Rescue 4x4, a free public rescue service, you can click on the 'Request help' link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Rescue 4x4 / 4x4 Volunteer Rescue Association'.

answers.answer: Shops are generally open from 9 or 10 am to 6 or 8 pm on weekdays, while department stores and some food stores open from 8 am to 8 pm Monday to Saturday and from 8:30 am to 1 pm on Sunday.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Opening hours'.

answers.answer: Legal public holidays for 2023 in Romania include January 1-2, January 24, April 22, April 24-25, May 1, June 1, June 12-13, August 15, November 30, and December 25-26.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Opening hours'.

answers.answer: No vaccinations are required for Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: All cities and most towns should have at least one 24-hour pharmacy; if not, you can dial the emergency number displayed in the pharmacy window.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children suffering from cancer can be directed to national cancer treatment centers via a platform developed by Dăruiește Aripi Association and the Romanian Pediatric Oncology and Hematology Society, or by contacting them directly via email at ukrainechildcancer@daruiestearipi.ro or phone at +40724024229.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: Ukrainians needing HIV treatment or services can contact Sens Positiv on Facebook, Instagram (@informathiv.ro), or by phone at 0744.682.225, who will refer and accompany them to HIV Focal Points.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: The main mobile phone providers in Romania are Orange, Telekom, and Vodafone.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Telecommunications Phones'.

answers.answer: The currency of Romania is the Romanian leu (RON), which is divided into 100 bani.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) can be exchanged for Romanian leu (RON) at BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank) at the BNR exchange rate, up to 1,000 lei per person with a Ukrainian passport.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: 112 is the single emergency telephone number available nationwide in Romania that can be called from all public telephone networks.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Useful contacts 112 Emergency Number'.

answers.answer: The Romanian Border Police can be contacted by calling +40 021.9590 to find out public information related to border crossing areas.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Useful contacts'.

answers.answer: Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers are located in Rădăuți, Maramureș, Galați, București, Timișoara, and Giurgiu.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: You can request resources like food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers by clicking the 'Request or provide resources' link under Sprijin de Urgență.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: You can find temporary accommodation or provide a space to help vulnerable people by accessing the 'Access Un Acoperiș!' link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș!'.
